par.text: Copper is a reddish-brown, malleable and ductile metal. It is an excellent conductor of heat and electricity, second only to silver. Copper is a semi-noble metal; at elevated temperatures it reacts with oxygen, sulphur, selenium, the halogens and the nitrogen group elements. Prolonged atmospheric exposure results in the formation of a thin coat of green patina. Copper reacts only with concentrated sulphuric(VI) and nitric(V) acids. Copper was known to man in prehistoric times. It was named after Cyprus (Latin
), where copper was mined in ancient times.
